params.name: options
params.doc: Options for assigning a schedule to a resource.

description:
The `createResource()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the created resource.
Bookings resources are created with a schedule. The schedule determines the resource's availability by the business's default working hours.

When creating a resource using `createResource()`, get the business resource's schedule ID and include it in the `schedules` object. The default hours can bee found in the Dashboard under **Settings** in the **Bookings** section, on the **Appointment hours** page.


> **Notes:**
>- The Wix Bookings app shows default business hours on the **Staff** page in the dashboard.
>- A resource can have one schedule only.
>- You can have up to 135 active resources and an additional 135 deleted resources.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the resource to delete.

description:
The `deleteResource()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when a resource is deleted.


Deleting a resource updates its status to `DELETED`.

You cannot delete a resource if it has booked sessions.


>**Notes:**
>- The Bookings app automatically creates a resource with a name and tag of value `"business"`. This resource is used for the business's schedule and working hours and cannot be deleted.
>- You can have up to 135 active resources and an additional 135 deleted resources.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

The `updateResource()` function returns a Promise that resolves when a resource is updated. Use this function to update all bookings resource information except for the resource's schedule. To update a resource's schedule use [`updateSchedule()`](#updateschedule).


>**Note:**
> When updating a resource you cannot change the system tags used by the Wix Bookings app. Tags used by the app have the values `"business"` and `"staff"`.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

examples.title: updateResource example
body: const result = await resources.updateResource(id, resource, options);

description:
The `updateSchedule()` function returns a Promise that resolves when a resource's schedule has been updated. Use this function to update the bookings resource's schedule. To update other resource details use [`updateResource()`](#updateresource).

> **Notes:**
>- A resource can have one schedule only.
>- When updating a resource's schedule you cannot change the system tags used by the Wix Bookings app. Tags used by the app have the values `"INDIVIDUAL"`, `"GROUP"`, and `"COURSE"`.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

examples.title: updateSchedule example
body: const result = await resources.updateSchedule(resourceId, schedule, options);

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number, as free text.

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, and Floor.

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: country
members.doc: Country code.

members.name: countryFullname
members.doc: Country full name.

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: A string containing the full address of this location.

members.name: geocode
members.doc: Coordinates of the physical address.

members.name: hint
members.doc: Free text to help find the address.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Zip/postal code.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street name, number and apartment number.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Subdivision. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: subdivisions
members.doc: Multi-level subdivisions from top to bottom.

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Address latitude.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Address longitude.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number, as free text.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street name, number and apartment number.

members.name: constraints
members.doc: Constraints for calculating the schedule's availability.

members.name: end
members.doc: Date and time the schedule stops being available for booking. No value indicates no end time.

members.name: linkedSchedules
members.doc: Other schedules that impact the availability calculation. Relevant only when there are availability constraints.

members.name: start
members.doc: Date and time the schedule starts to be available for booking.

description:
<!-- Needs updating when recurrence has been tested
Schedule's availability calculation is executed by the schedule's available intervals and this additional information.
Schedule's available intervals are recurring intervals (defined in the schedule) minus sessions that has no more spots for bookings (including time between_slots), or schedule's sessions with open spots for bookings.-->

members.name: slotDurations
members.doc:
A list of duration options for slots, in minutes. Minimum value for a duration is 1.
The availability calculation generates slots with these durations, where there is no conflict with existing sessions or other availability constraints.

members.name: slotsSplitInterval
members.doc: An object defining the time between available slots' start times.  For example, a slot with slots_split_interval=5 can start every 5 minutes. The default is the slot duration.

members.name: splitInterval
members.doc:
Specify how to split the slots in intervals of minutes.
This value indicates the time between available slots' start time. e.g., from 5 minute slots (3:00, 3:05, 3:15) and 1 hour slots (3:00, 4:00, 5:00).
Optional. The default is the first duration in slot_durations field.
Deprecated. Use the `split_slots_interval.value_in_minutes`.

members.name: timeBetweenSlots
members.doc:
The number of minutes between the `end` of one slot, and the `start` of the next.
Minimum value is 0, maximum value is 120.

description: Describes how to calculate the specific slots that are available for booking.

members.name: batchedResources
members.doc: Optional. If provided, the resources field is ignored.

members.name: resources
members.doc: List of resource entities to create.

members.name: batchedResources
members.doc: Optional. If provided, the resources field is ignored.

members.name: resources
members.doc: List of resource entities to create.

members.name: resources
members.doc: List of the created resources.

members.name: ids
members.doc: List of resource IDs to delete.

members.name: cancelRequests
members.doc:
Cancel multiple schedules.
The given schedules move to a CANCELLED status which means that all sessions up until
the cancellation point in time are kept, while removing all following sessions.

members.name: createRequests
members.doc: Create multiple schedules.

members.name: updateRequests
members.doc: Update multiple schedules. Not Supported yet.

members.name: cancelled
members.doc: Cancelled schedules.

members.name: created
members.doc: Created schedules.

members.name: updated
members.doc: Updated schedules.

members.name: locationId
members.doc: The ID of the business location. Has to be non-empty

members.name: periods
members.doc: Weekly recurring time periods when the business is regularly open or the service is available. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: specialHourPeriod
members.doc: Exceptions to the business's regular hours. The business can be open or closed during the exception.

description: Business schedule. Regular and exceptional time periods when the business is open or the service is available.

members.name: guestUrl
members.doc: URL used by a guest to join the conference.

members.name: hostUrl
members.doc: URL used by the host to start the conference.

members.name: from
members.doc: Time to cancel the sessions from. Optional. If this field is empty, all of this schedule's sessions will be canceled.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Deprecated, use participant_notification

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

members.name: preserveFutureSessionsWithParticipants
members.doc: Whether to preserve future sessions with reservations. Defaults to false.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Conferencing provider ID

members.name: schedules
members.doc:
List of schedules to be assigned for the created resource. Currently only a single schedule is allowed.
If provided, any schedules in the resource entity will be ignored.

members.name: resource
members.doc: Resource to create.

members.name: schedules
members.doc:
List of schedules to be assigned for the created resource. Currently only a single schedule is allowed.
If provided, any schedules in the resource entity will be ignored.

members.name: resource
members.doc: Created resource.

members.name: schedule
members.doc: Schedule.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc: ID of the resource to delete.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Deleted resource ID.

members.name: description
members.doc: Synced description of the external calendar event.

members.name: title
members.doc: Synced title of the external calendar event.

members.name: repetition
members.doc: The frequency of the recurrence in weeks. i.e. when this value is 4, the interval occurs every 4 weeks. Optional. The default is 1. minimum: 1, maximum: 52.

members.name: daysOfWeek
members.doc: The day the interval accrue. Optional. The default is the day of the recurring interval's start time.

members.name: duration
members.doc: The duration of the interval in minutes. Required. Part of the session end time calculation. minimum: 1, maximum: 86400.

members.name: hourOfDay
members.doc: The hour of the day the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval start time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 23.

members.name: minuteOfHour
members.doc: The minutes of hour the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval end time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 59.

members.name: resourceId
members.doc: The id of the resource to link.

members.name: userId
members.doc: The id of Wix user to link.

members.name: resource
members.doc: The updated resource.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Owner ID, of the linked schedule.

members.name: transparency
members.doc:
Sets this schedule's availability for the duration of the linked schedule's sessions.  Default is `"BUSY"`.
<!--ONLY:REST-->
If set to `"BUSY"`, this schedule cannot have any available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
If set to `"FREE"`, this schedule can have available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"FREE"` This schedule can have available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
- `"BUSY"` This schedule cannot have any available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: resources
members.doc: List of resources matching the query object.

members.name: address
members.doc: Free text address used when locationType is `OWNER_CUSTOM`.

members.name: customAddress
members.doc: Custom address, used when locationType is `"OWNER_CUSTOM"`. Might be used when locationType is `"CUSTOM"` in case the owner sets a custom address for the session which is different from the default.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
Location type.
One of:
- `"OWNER_BUSINESS"` The business address as set in the siteâ€™s general settings.
- `"OWNER_CUSTOM"` The address as set when creating the service.
- `"CUSTOM"` The address set for the individual session.

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: country
members.doc: 2-letter country code in an [ISO-3166 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) format.

members.name: formatted
members.doc: Full address of the location.

members.name: location
members.doc: Geographic coordinates of location.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Postal or zip code.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street address. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Code for a subdivision (such as state, prefecture, or province) in [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) format.

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Latitude of the location. Must be between -90 and 90.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Longitude of the location. Must be between -180 and 180.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Location ID.

members.name: address
members.doc: Address.

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Whether the location is archived. Archived locations can't be updated.
__Note:__ [Archiving a location](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/business-info/locations/archive-location)
doesn't affect its `status`.

members.name: businessSchedule
members.doc:
Business schedule. Array of weekly recurring time periods when the location is open for business. Limited to 100 time periods.

__Note:__ Not supported by Wix Bookings.

members.name: default
members.doc: Whether this is the default location. There can only be one default location per site. The default location can't be archived.

members.name: description
members.doc: Location description.

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address.

members.name: fax
members.doc: Fax number.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
Location type.

**Note:** Currently not supported.

members.name: name
members.doc: Location name.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the location is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing revision must be used when updating a location.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Location status. Defaults to `ACTIVE`.
__Note:__ [Archiving a location](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/business-info/locations/archive-location)
doesn't affect the location's status. `INACTIVE` is currently not supported.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: Timezone in `America/New_York` format.

members.name: apt
members.doc: Apartment number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

description: Street address. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Participant ID. Currently represents the booking.id.

members.name: approvalStatus
members.doc:
Approval status for the participant.
<!-- Commented out untill updateParticipant is exposed Generally the same status as the booking, unless updated using the `updateParticipant()` API. Defaults to `"UNDEFINED"`.-->
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"PENDING"` Pending business approval.
- `"APPROVED"` Approved by the business.
- `"DECLINED"` Declined by the business.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID.

members.name: email
members.doc: Participant's email address.

members.name: inherited
members.doc: Whether the participant was inherited from the schedule, as opposed to being booked directly to the session.

members.name: name
members.doc: Participant's name.

members.name: partySize
members.doc: Group or party size. The number of people attending. Defaults to 0. Maximum is 250.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Participant's phone number.

members.name: message
members.doc: Custom message to send to the participants about the changes to the booking.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc:
Whether to send the message about the changes to the customer.

Default: `false`

members.name: amount
members.doc: Required payment amount.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency in which the amount is quoted.

members.name: downPayAmount
members.doc: Amount of a down payment or deposit as part of the transaction.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: resources
members.doc: List of resources matching the query object.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: labeledPriceOptions
members.doc:
Mapping between a named price option, for example, adult or child prices, and the price, currency, and down payment amount.
When present in an update request, the `default_varied_price` is ignored to support backward compatibility.

members.name: priceText
members.doc:
Textual price information used when **Price Per Session** is set to **Custom Price** in the app's service details page.
When present in an update request, the `default_varied_price` is ignored to support backward compatibility.

members.name: _id
members.doc: The recurring interval identifier.

members.name: affectedSchedules
members.doc: Specifies the list of linked schedules and the way this link affects the corresponding schedules' availability. Can be calculated from the schedule or overridden on the recurring interval.

members.name: end
members.doc: The end time of the recurring interval. Optional. Empty value indicates that there is no end time.

members.name: frequency
members.doc: The frequency of the interval. Optional. The default is frequency with the default repetition.

members.name: interval
members.doc: The interval rules. The day, hour and minutes the interval is recurring.

members.name: intervalType
members.doc:
The type of recurring interval.
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"UNDEFINED"` The default value. Sessions for this interval will be of type EVENT.
- `"EVENT"` A recurring interval of events.
- `"WORKING_HOURS"` A recurring interval for availability.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: start
members.doc: The start time of the recurring interval. Required.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Resource ID.

members.name: description
members.doc: Resource description.

members.name: email
members.doc: Resource email address.

members.name: images
members.doc: Resource images.

members.name: name
members.doc: Resource name.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Resource phone number.

members.name: scheduleIds
members.doc: List of IDs of schedules owned by this resource.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Resource status.

One of:
- `"CREATED"` Default status.
- `"DELETED"` The resource was deleted.
- `"UPDATED"` The resource was updated.

members.name: tags
members.doc: Resource tags. Tags are used to identify, group, and filter the different types of resources. For example, 'staff' or 'room'.

members.name: wixUserId
members.doc:
Wix user ID, if the resource is associated with the Wix user.
A staff member resource can be associated with a Wix user via assignment of a permissions role in the business manager.
<!--ONLY:VELO
Click the **Set Permissions** button for the staff member on the Staff page on your site's dashboard.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: event
members.doc: Event type.

members.name: resource
members.doc:
Updated resource entity.
'resource.schedules' is deprecated and will not be returned. Please use 'resource.scheduleIds' instead.

members.name: fieldmask
members.doc: Fieldmask for schedule

members.name: resourceId
members.doc: Resource ID to update.

members.name: schedule
members.doc: Schedule to update.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: calendarConference
members.doc: A conference created for the schedule. This is used when a participant is added to a schedule.

members.name: capacity
members.doc: Maximum number of participants that can be added to the schedule's sessions. Must be at most `1` for schedule whose availability is affected by another schedule. For example, appointment schedules of the Wix Bookings app.

members.name: created
members.doc: Schedule creation date.

members.name: inheritedFields
members.doc: Fields which were inherited from the Business Info page under Settings in the Dashboard.

members.name: location
members.doc: Default location for the schedule's sessions.

members.name: participants
members.doc:
*Partial list** of participants which are registered to sessions in this schedule.
Participants who are registered in the schedule are automatically registered to any session that is created for the schedule.
To retrieve the full list of schedule participants please use the [Query Extended Bookings API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/bookings-reader-v2/query-extended-bookings).

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: ID of the schedule's owner entity. This may be a resource ID or a service ID.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Schedule status.

One of:
- `"CREATED"`
- `"CANCELLED"`

Default: `"CREATED"`

members.name: tags
members.doc:
Tags for grouping schedules. These tags are the default tags for the schedule's sessions.
The Wix Bookings app uses the following predefined tags to set schedule type: `"INDIVIDUAL"`, `"GROUP"`, and `"COURSE"`. Once the schedule type is set using these tags, you cannot update it. In addition to the app's tags, you can create and update your own tags.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc:
Schedule's time zone in [Area/Location](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tz_database) format. Read-only.
Derived from the Wix Business time zone.

members.name: title
members.doc: Default title for the schedule's sessions. Maximum length: 6000 characters.

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc: Number of participants registered to sessions in this schedule, calculated as the sum of the party sizes.

members.name: updated
members.doc: Schedule last update date.

members.name: version
members.doc: Schedule version number, updated each time the schedule is updated.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: comment
members.doc: Additional info about the exception. For example, "We close earlier on New Year's Eve."

members.name: endDate
members.doc: End date and time of the exception in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format and [Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time).

members.name: isClosed
members.doc:
Whether the business is closed (or the service is not available) during the exception.

Default: `true`.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Start date and time of the exception in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format and [Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time).

description: Exception to the business's regular hours. The business can be open or closed during the exception.

members.name: sameAsDuration
members.doc:
Whether the slot duration is used as the split interval value.
If `same_as_duration` is `true`, the `value_in_minutes` is the sum of the first duration in
`schedule.availabilityConstraints.SlotDurations` field, and `schedule.availabilityConstraints.TimeBetweenSlots` field.

members.name: valueInMinutes
members.doc: Number of minutes between available slots' start times when `same_as_duration` is `false`.

description: The time between available slots' start times. For example, For 5 minute slots, 3:00, 3:05, 3:15 etc. For 1 hour slots, 3:00, 4:00, 5:00 etc.

members.name: apt
members.doc: Apartment number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

members.name: code
members.doc: Subdivision code. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: name
members.doc: Subdivision full name.

members.name: closeDay
members.doc: Day of the week the period ends on.

members.name: closeTime
members.doc:
Time the period ends in 24-hour [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) extended format. Valid values are `00:00` to `24:00`, where `24:00` represents
midnight at the end of the specified day.

__Note:__ If `openDay` and `closeDay` specify the same day of the week `closeTime` must be later than `openTime`.

members.name: openDay
members.doc: Day of the week the period starts on.

members.name: openTime
members.doc:
Time the period starts in 24-hour [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) extended format. Valid values are `00:00` to `24:00`, where `24:00` represents
midnight at the end of the specified day.

description: Weekly recurring time periods when the business is regularly open or the service is available.
